info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:55AM EST until February 21 at 11:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana, southwest Michigan and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in northern Indiana, Allen IN, De Kalb, Kosciusko, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wabash and Whitley. In southwest Michigan, Branch and Hillsdale. In northwest Ohio, Williams. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM EST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - The snowpack has melted with ponding of water on roads and poor drainage areas increasing in many rural areas. The areal flooding will likely continue through the early afternoon, though the rain will taper off this morning and change to a mix of ice and snow this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Wayne, Auburn, Coldwater, Kendallville, Columbia City, Angola, Hillsdale, Garrett, Ligonier, Butler, Lagrange, Tri- lakes, Huntertown, Avilla, Bronson, Albion, Hudson, Jonesville, Waterloo and Fremont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
